message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ribavirin is known to cause hemolytic anemia, as it can cause a breakdown of red blood cells. Drug-associated lupus is not a common side effect of ribavirin. Hyperthyroidism is a rare side effect and rash is less common than hemolytic anemia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ribavirin can cause hemolytic anemia, which is the most common side effect. It can also cause rash, but hemolytic anemia is a more common side effect. Drug-associated lupus and hyperthyroidism are not known side effects of ribavirin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ribavirin can cause hemolytic anemia by inducing oxidative stress on erythrocytes. Drug-associated lupus is a potential side-effect of interferon, which is also part of the treatment, but this was not the question. Hyperthyroidism can occur as a side-effect of interferon as well, but again, the question specifically asks about ribavirin. Rash is a possible side-effect of both medications, but hemolytic anemia is the most common and well-known side-effect of ribavirin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ribavirin treatment can cause hemolytic anemia, which is the most likely side-effect. Drug-associated lupus is more commonly associated with other medications. Hyperthyroidism and rash are not commonly reported side-effects of ribavirin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. While taking ribavirin, the most common side-effect is hemolytic anemia, which occurs in up to 20% of patients. Drug-associated lupus is a potential side-effect of interferon therapy. Hyperthyroidism is a rare side-effect of interferon therapy. Rash is a rare side-effect of ribavirin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ribavirin can cause hemolytic anemia, which is the breakdown of red blood cells. Drug-associated lupus can also occur, but it is less common. Hyperthyroidism and rash are not common side effects of ribavirin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ribavirin is known to cause hemolytic anemia, which is the destruction of red blood cells. Drug-induced lupus is associated with interferon therapy, not ribavirin. Hyperthyroidism is not a known side effect of either medication. Rash is a possible side effect of both medications, but hemolytic anemia is the most likely response.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only hemolytic anemia is a known side-effect of ribavirin. This side-effect is seen in up to 10% of patients taking ribavirin and presents as a decrease in hemoglobin levels. Drug-associated lupus is a rare side-effect of interferon therapy. Hyperthyroidism is a potentially serious side-effect of interferon therapy, but not ribavirin. Rash is a known side-effect of both interferon and ribavirin, but it is not the most likely side-effect while taking ribavirin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hemolytic anemia is a common side effect of ribavirin. Drug-associated lupus is a side effect of interferon, not ribavirin. Hyperthyroidism is not a known side effect of either medication. Rash can occur but is not the most likely side effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ribavirin can cause hemolytic anemia, which occurs when the body destroys red blood cells faster than it can make them. This is the most common side effect of ribavirin. Drug-associated lupus and hyperthyroidism are not commonly associated with ribavirin treatment, and rashes are less common than hemolytic anemia.
